alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 10:16AM EST until February 28 at 5:17AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is expected to continue. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Friday was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.8 feet just after midnight Friday. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 11/20/1957. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 7 PM on Friday, February 25th.
